input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Find Contact This wrapper search out for the contact record(s) from pool of contact records in the application Sample Item Xml: <items> <item> <operation-name>retrieve-contact</operation-name> <model> <keys> <contact-name> <value>MyContactName2</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> </keys> <instance> <contact-name> <value>MyContactName2</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <employee-i-d> <value>employee i d</value> <type>String</type> </employee-i-d> <shift> <value>Shift</value> <type>String</type> </shift> <department> <value>department</value> <type>String</type> </department> <last-name> <value>last name</value> <type>String</type> </last-name> <first-name> <value>first name</value> <type>String</type> </first-name> <work-phone> <value>Work phone</value> <type>String</type> </work-phone> <extension> <value>Extension</value> <type>String</type> </extension> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <floor> <value>Floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <email> <value>Email</value> <type>String</type> </email> <home-phone> <value>Home phone</value> <type>String</type> </home-phone> <primary-configuration-item> <value>Primary Configuration Item</value> <type>String</type> </primary-configuration-item> <building> <value>Building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <mobile-phone> <value>Portable</value> <type>String</type> </mobile-phone> <company> <value>Company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <manager> <value>Manager</value> <type>String</type> </manager> <contract-i-d> <value>19</value> <type>Decimal</type> </contract-i-d> <critical-user> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </critical-user> <requires-entitlement> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </requires-entitlement> <full-name> <value>FullNamenew</value> <type>String</type> </full-name> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Locating any record takes place in following manner-
The fields inside instance describe the record. Out of which some are key elements.
Following are cases,
Case1: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only key then the record is uniquely located.
Case2: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) key element(s) along with some other elements then the record is located only by key elements. All other fields (elements) get ignored. Record would get uniquely located as we’re providing the key element(s).
Case3: You provide (either in <keys> or in <instance> or in both) only those elements that are not key. Then the record is located by logically ANDing all those elements with the corresponding elements of existing record.
Case4: You don’t provide anything. Then all company records would be fetched.
NOTE: When we provide some element(s) (which are not key) in <keys> element then we’re forcibly saying that “search the record(s) with these key elements (the elements in <keys> element.)” In such cases, the elements given inside <instance> element are simply ignored.
NOTE: For a given pattern string P is said to be matched with text string T if the string P is prefix string of T. for example,
P = xyz T = xyz123 Then P is matched with T.
If, P = xyz T = 1xyz23 Then P is not matched with T.
etc.
this means, if you’re searching for vendor, and you’ve given vendor name to be “abc” and if there are two records with vendor name “abc123” and “abc456” then both these record would be fetched.
(this is solely application specific.)
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required] This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required] :
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>retrieve-contact</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required] : used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Contact-name[Optional]: Contact name field.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Contact Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Employee-i-d [Optional]: The id if employee.
Name of this element in the application: Businesss > Employee ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Shift [Optional]: a field in the contact record.
Name of this field in the application: Business > Shift.
Valid Values: Any string.
Department[Optional]: The department field.
Name of this field in the application: Business > Dept Name
Valid Values: any string, or you can select any existing record from the application.
Last-name[Optional]: the last name.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
First-name[Optional]: The first name.
Name of this element in the application: this field seems to be hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Work-phone[Optional]: the work phone related to the record.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Work Phone.
Valid Values: Any string.
Extension[Optional]: The extension number.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Extension.
Valid Values: Any string.
Location [Optional]: The location information.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Location.
Valid values: Any string.
Floor[Optional] : A field in the address.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Floor.
Valid Values: Any string.
Email [Optional]: the email id.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Email.
Valid Values: Any string.
Home-phone[Optional]: Home phone number.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Home.
Valid Values: Any string.
Primary-configuration-item [Optional]: The primary item type.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Primary Configuration item.
Valid values: Any string.
Building[Optional]: the building information.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Building.
Valid Values: Any string.
Mobile-phone[Optional]: the mobile phone number.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Company[Optional]: The company information related to the record.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Company.
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing record form the application repository.
Manager [Optional]: The manager name.
Name of this field in the application: Business > manager.
Valid value: Any string.
Contract-i-d[Optional]: the contract id.
Name of this element in the application: This field seems to be hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Critical-user[Optional]: to tell whether the user is critical or not.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Critical User(Radio Button)
Valid Values: true/ false. True -> user is critical, false -> user is not critical.
Requires-entitlement[Optional]: to tell whether user requires entitlement.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Requires Entitlement(radio button)
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.). True -> users requires entitlement, false -> user doesn’t require.
Full-name [Optional]: the full name of the user.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Full Name.
Valid Values: Any string.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Find Contact
This wrapper search out for the contact record(s) from pool of contact records in the application
